item.title: May 14, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Ricardo Amerigo Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a musical mystery. Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates January 19 and 20, 1956. CBS network. Running times 13:50, 13:50) 0:30:00 - Life With The Lyons "Mothering Sunday" Bebe Daniels and her real-life family star in this premiere British sitcom (Original air date March 31, 1957. BBC. Running time 30:27) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Pretty Mama" Hank Marble has been shot in the back, leaving behind a young and pretty widow. (Original air date November 11, 1956. CBS network. Running time 22:37) 1:20:00 - Aladdin Lamp With Smilin' Ed McConnell (Original air date 1937. Syndicated, NBC Orthacoustic transcription.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Little Mother" A woman has been forging charge slips in department stores for the last six years. (Original air date October 6, 1953. NBC network. Running time 26:24) 2:00:00 - The Life Of Riley Riley and the family have big plans to pamper Pam on Mother's Day — but one by one they fall afoul. (Original air date May 14, 1944. NBC Blue network. Running time 22:25) 2:25:00 - The Hank Williams Mother's Best Flour Show (Original air date March 15, 1951. WSM station. Running time 11:33) 2:30:00 - The Lone Ranger A soldier is shot while deserting to help his blind mother. (Original air date February 16, 1944. Running time 28:25) 3:00:00 - The Lux Radio Theatre "Lady For A Day" A comedy-drama about Apple Annie, a Depression-era street person. Her daughter is arriving from Spain, thinking her mother is a society matron. (Original air date May 1, 1939. CBS network. Running time 30:34)

item.title: May 7, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Ricardo Amerigo Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a famous violin sparks mystery and danger. Parts 1, 2 & 3. (Original air dates January 16, 17 and 18, 1956. CBS network. Running times 13:34, 13:34, 13:34) 0:45:00 - Stay Tuned For Terror "The Man Who Raised the Dead" Author Robert Bloch's tale written for especially for radio, about the awesome power and responsibility of reanimating the dead. (Original air date July 27, 1945. WMAQ station. Running time 13:25) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Brother Whelp" A gunfighter returns to Dodge after six years, and he finds his old girlfriend married to his brother. (Original air date November 18, 1956. CBS network. Running time 22:37) 1:20:00 - Dragnet "The Big Friend" Mr. Gray reports that his wife Hazel has been murdered, but there is something suspicious about the circumstances. (Original air date April 5, 1951. NBC network. Running time 25:58) 1:50:00 - Radio Retrospective: V.E. Day, excerpts 2:00:00 - My Friend Irma Irma's boss has purchased a race horse named, "Laughing Boy." (Original air date June 2, 1953. CBS network. Running time 24:49) 2:30:00 - The Cavalcade Of America "Commencement In Khaki" A romance about the post-war Army College at Camp Kilmer, New Jersey. (Original air date January 28, 1946. CBS network. Running time 25:47) 3:00:00 - Murder By Experts "Summer Heat" A newly graduated lawyer awakes with a dead body in bed and has a very difficult time getting rid of that body! (Original air date June 13, 1949. Mutual network. Running time 28:33) 3:30:00 - New World A' Coming "The Meaning Of V-E Day To Negroes" Oliver Harrington, a foreign correspondent for the Pittsburgh Courier, interviews "average" New York Black Americans. (Original air date May 20, 1945. WMCA station. Running time 24:59)

item.title: April 30, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Caylin Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a man is found dead and there are too many suspects. Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates January 5 and 6, 1956. CBS network. Running times 13:36, 13:53, 13:45) 0:30:00 - Our Miss Brooks Madison High is holding an auction of some very nice furniture, perhaps Mr. Conklin would care to donate? (Original air date March 19, 1950. CBS network. Running time 26:13) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Crowbait Bob" An old man dies and leaves everything to Kitty. (Original air date November 10, 1956. CBS network. Running time 22:37) 1:20:00 - Radio Retrospective: 1948 Kentucky Derby with Clem McCarthy (Original air date May 1, 1948. CBS network.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Trunk" A divorcee named Josephine Allen has been murdered, and her body found in a car trunk. (Original air date September 7, 1954. NBC network. Running time 26:11) 2:00:00 - The Jack Benny Program For Grape-Nuts and Grape-Nuts Flakes. Jack has sold a broken down horse to Rochester for $4. Rochester's entered him in the Kentucky Derby! (Original air date April 25, 1943. NBC Red network. Running time 29:29) 2:30:00 - Suspense "Elementals" Stephen Vincent Benét's story of primal instinct versus human resolve. Can a man and a woman go without food for one week, and then not fight each other for a crumb? (Original air date June 12, 1960. CBS network. Running time 24:21) 3:00:00 - Four For The Fifth "The Laughter" Fred MacMurray stars in this story of the courage of resilience and evils of complacency. (Original air date June 17, 1944. Treasury Department syndication. Running time 30:34) 3:30:00 - Mr. Keen, Tracer Of Lost Persons "The Engaged Girl Murder Case" Mr. Keen solves a murder case while on horseback! (Original air date November 10, 1949. CBS network. Running time 26:17)

item.title: April 23, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Caylin Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a man is found dead and there are too many suspects. Parts 1, 2 & 3. (Original air dates January 2, 3 and 4, 1956. CBS network. Running times 13:36, 13:36, 13:36) 0:45:00 - Radio Retrospective: Dorothy Thompson An excerpt from an NBC special broadcast, Ms. Thompson reports on Nazi Germany's invasion of Poland. (Original air date September 2, 1939. NBC network. Running time approximately 10:00) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Dirty Bill's Girl" Rose, the card dealer in the Long Branch, plans to kill a man. (Original air date October 28, 1956. CBS network. Running time 22:32) 1:20:00 - Symphony Sid, excerpt. Tito Puente performs in a band remote from the "Birdland" club in New York City. (Original air date September 22, 1952.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Ben" A man is pulled from his car on a deserted street, robbed, and beaten viciously before his car is stolen. (Original air date March 15, 1951. NBC network. Running time 26:07) 2:00:00 - The Halls of Ivy Dr. Hall has been asked to recite a poem for an appreciative audience, but is reluctant to participate. (Original air date July 5, 1950. NBC network. Running time 26:47) 2:30:00 - Will of Stratford An NBC special program celebrating the 373rd anniversary of William Shakespeare's birth. (Original air date April 15, 1937. NBC network. Running time 29:52) 3:00:00 - Suspense "Make Mad The Guilty" Hume Cronyn stars as an out-of-work Shakespearean actor who fakes his own death when his wife leaves him for her muscular lover. (Original air date April 10, 1948. CBS network. Running time 29:22) 3:30:00 - The Lady Esther Screen Guild Theatre "First Love" Shirley Temple stars in this modern Cinderella story about a young girl who finds romance, despite her cruel relatives. (Original air date May 14, 1945. CBS network. Running time 26:39)

item.title: April 16, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Forbes Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; mystery abounds in a NY embezzlement case. Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates December 29 and 30, 1955. CBS network. Running times 13:32 and 14:32) 0:45:00 - The Stan Freberg Show Program number 1. Comedian Stan Freberg lampoons the entertainment industry, and Las Vegas casinos. (Original air date July 14, 1957. CBS network. Running time 29:40) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Til Death Do Us" (Original air date October 21, 1956. CBS network. Running time 24:50) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Couple" A confidence team specializes in victimizing churches and clergymen. (Original air date February 22, 1951. NBC network. Running time 25:51) 2:00:00 - The Raleigh Room The incomparable Hildegarde visits with special guests Hank Greenberg, Paul McGrath and Jackie Keck. (Original air date October 16, 1945. NBC network. Running time 29:38) 2:30:00 - The Cavalcade Of America "Sawdust Underground" The story of two G. I.'s who escape from Nazi occupied France by hiding as a clown and an acrobat in a circus. (Original air date September 10, 1945. NBC network. Running time 29:11) 3:00:00 - Suspense "Crossfire" Starring three Roberts: Robert Young, Robert Ryan, Robert Mitchum. A murder mystery about a fanatical antisemite. Which of three soldiers committed murder? (Original air date April 10, 1948. CBS network. Running time 59:30)

item.title: April 9, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Forbes Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; mystery abounds in a NY embezzlement case. Parts 1, 2 & 3. (Original air dates December 26, 27 and 28, 1955. CBS network.) 0:45:00 - Stay Tuned For Terror "The BoogeyMan Will Get You" A psychological thriller about a teenage girl's suspicions and a bachelor. (Original air date 1945. Station WMAQ) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Gunshot wound" Revenge exacts a deadly toll. (Original air date October 14, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Radio retrospective: Mercury 7 Press Conference, April 9 1959. 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Cast" Over a dozen men have disappeared without a trace. (Original air date February 8, 1951. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - The Lucky Strike Program Starring Jack Benny Benny's traditional Easter Sunday show – he and Mary Livingstone stroll down Wilshire Boulevard in Los Angeles, singing "Happy Easter," and encountering their friends along the way. (Original air date April 13, 1952. CBS network.) 2:30:00 - The Greatest Story Ever Told "The Resurrection" (Original air date April 06, 1947. ABC network.) 3:00:00 - The Great Gildersleeve Sunrise Easter service and an unexpected blessing. (Original air date April 9, 1952. NBC network.) 3:30:00 - The Six-Shooter A Big Broadcast Easter tradition; Jimmy Stewart stars as Brett Poinset, and investigates a crisis at Easter Creek. (Original air date April 15, 1954. NBC network.)

item.title: April 2, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Todd Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; an expensive tip from an ex-con starts Johnny on the trail of stolen goods, and a murder attempt; Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates January 12 and 13, 1956. CBS network.) 0:30:00 - Take It Or Leave It Fred Allen and his cast of regulars take on inflation, rationing, and Veronica Lake's new ‘do; Falstaff Openshaw recites a poem on rationing. (Original air date February 28, 1943. NBC network) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "The Gambler" A riverboat gambler named Jim Ascombe comes to Dodge to kill Jim Cass (Original air date October 07, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Radio retrospective: Interview with Jack Webb, from 1958 reel to reel tape interview. 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Children" A mother is missing, and her children are begging for food. (Original air date February 01, 1951. NBC network.) 1:50:00 - Excerpt from Anthology "The Three Witches of Macbeth" Alec Guinness stars in scenes from Shakespeare's Scottish Play. (Original air date February 01, 1951. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - Dangerous Assignment Plans for an improved Nazi "buzz bomb" have been stolen. (Original air date February 24, 1951. NBC network.) 2:30:00 - Eternal Light "The Passover Of Rembrandt Van Rijn" The famous painter of Amsterdam is commissioned to paint Moses for the city fathers. He searches for descendants of the biblical figure to use for his model. (Original air date April 18, 1948. NBC network.) 3:00:00 - The CBS Radio Mystery Theatre "The Corpse That Would Not Die" A suspenseful tale adapted from Émile Zola's Thérèse Raquin (Original air date June 07, 1976. CBS network.) 3:30:00 - Lum and Abner A haunting we will go! (Original air date October 07, 1943. Blue network.)

item.title: March 26, 2023 - Git
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Todd Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; an expensive tip from an ex-con starts Johnny on the trail of stolen goods, and a murder attempt; Parts 1, 2 &3. (Original air dates January 9, 10 and 11, 1956. CBS network.) 0:40:00 - X Minus One "Martian Sam" The Los Angeles Dodgers sign a real Martian as a left-handed pitcher. (Original air date April 3, 1957. NBC network) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "The Brothers" (Original air date September 30, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Dragnet "The Big Tomato" Friday and the L.A. police track down "The Big Tomato" (Original air date January 25, 1951. NBC network.) 1:50:00 - Interview with Susan Stamberg and Deanna Hackney discussing "Women in the Newsroom" 2:00:00 - The Cavalcade Of America "Nellie Was A Lady" The adventures of Nellie Bly, trailblazer reporter for the New York World, who made an around the world journey in less than eighty days, and forever opened up opportunities for women reporters. (Original air date September 17, 1945. NBC network.) 2:30:00 - Destination Freedom "The Ballad Of Satchell Paige" The story of the "greatest pitcher of all time." (Original air date May 15, 1949. Station WMAQ.) 3:00:00 - Our Miss Brooks Sometimes called "The Baseball Uniform Shortage", Madison High doesn't have enough funds to have a baseball team this spring, but Miss Brooks has a plan, naturally. (Original air date March 26, 1950. CBS network.) 3:30:00 - The Adventures Of Philip Marlowe "The Anniversary Gift". A rare appearance of William Conrad as Philip Marlowe; Marlowe is hired to retrieve a valuable platinum watch from a corpse. (Original air date April 11, 1950. CBS network.)

item.title: March 19, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Lansing Fraud" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a man with a $50,000 policy dies but the cause is suspicious; Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates December 15 and 16, 1955. CBS network.) 0:40:00 - The Adventures of Jane Arden "Elevator Murder" Part One, News reporter Jane Arden is trapped in a crowded elevator with a killer, but who is it? Written by Marianne Prugh. (Original air date January 15, 1941. Webber Productions syndication) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Box O'rocks" Marshall Dillon must solve the mystery of a faux funeral and a coffin filled with rocks. (Original air date September 23 1956. CBS network.) 1:37:00 - Dragnet "The Big Dance" (Original air date January 18, 1951. NBC network.) 2:17:00 - Night Beat Randy Stone dials his phone at random and speaks to a woman about to be murdered by her insane husband. (Original air date July 31, 1950. NBC network.) 3:00:00 - The Lux Radio Theatre "Front Page Woman" Paulette Goddard and Fred MacMurray co-star in this adaptation of the film about two news reporters duking it out for clout in the newsroom. (Original air date January 16, 1939. CBS network.)

item.title: March 12, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Lansing Fraud" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar; a man with a $50,000 policy dies but the cause is suspicious; Parts 1, 2 &3. (Original air dates December 12, 13, and 14, 1955. CBS network.) 0:44:00 - Policewoman "The Case Of The Scheming Bridegroom" Based on the adventures of the real New York City policewoman, Mary Sullivan. (Original air date June 29, 1947. ABC network) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Thick ‘n' Thin" Two old friends begin fighting. (Original air date September 16, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Franklin D. Roosevelt addresses the nation for the first time as President of the United States, excerpt (Original air date March 12 1933. All networks.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Holdup" Detective Friday and his partner are after a viscous killer known as "The Rattlesnake Bandit" . (Original air date January 4, 1951. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - Maxwell House Coffee Time Gracie is inspired to train Girl Scouts-to-be, as the Girl Scouts celebrate their thirty seventh anniversary. (Original air date March 10, 1949. NBC network.) 2:30:00 - The Whistler "Married To Murder" Cathy Lewis and Elliot Lewis star in a twisted tale of the art of murder. (Original air date September 25, 1944. CBS network.) 3:00:00 - Author Meets The Critics A discussion about "American Argument," by Pearl Buck and Eslanda Goode Robeson. (Original air date February 06, 1949. NBC network, WNBC New York.) 3:30:00 - The Railroad Hour "Spring Is Here". Gordon MacRae stars in this rare musical adaptation of an even rarer musical by Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart (Original air date May 12, 1952. NBC network.)

item.title: March 5, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Cronin Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar is pulled in to protect a gorgeous and valuable necklace with diamonds and emeralds, known as the "Circle Of Fire" ; Parts 4 & 5. (Original air dates December 8 and 9, 1955. CBS network.) 0:30:00 - The Marriage Jessica Tandy and Hume Cronyn star; Elizabeth wants a more meaningful life. (Original air date November 15, 1953.) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Belle's Back" A woman named Belle has returned to Dodge, after living with a gunman. (Original air date September 9, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Oscar Brand's Folk Song Festival, excerpt featuring Doc Watson (Original air date 1970. WNYC station.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Break" As slippery a devil as Friday and Romero have ever encountered. (Original air date December 14, 1950. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - You Are There "The Trial Of Anne Hutchinson" Puritans put the first American feminist on trial in 1637. (Original air date September 26, 1948. CBS network.) 2:30:00 - The Private Files Of Rex Saunders "High Dividends Or Shallow Graves" Rex Harrison stars as a "gentleman detective". (Original air date May 30, 1951. NBC network.) 3:00:00 - The NBC University Theatre "Hedda Gabler" Ibsen's classic play portrays hardship and life troubles faced by women during 19th century. (Original air date August 27, 1950. NBC network.)

item.title: February 26, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Cronin Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar is pulled in to protect a gorgeous and valuable necklace with diamonds and emeralds, known as the "Circle Of Fire" ; Parts 1, 2, and 3. (Original air dates December 5, 6 and 7, 1955. CBS network.) 0:30:00 - It's Time To Smile, excerpt Guest Betty Hutton wows the crowd on Eddie Cantor's show, also starring Rudy Vallee. (Original air date January 27, 1943. NBC Red.) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Old Pal" A man is murdered, and the Wells Fargo money stolen; suspicion circles around a young woman trying to leave town. (Original air date September 02, 1956. CBS network.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Picture" Sergeant Friday breaks a vicious Los Angeles pornography ring. (Original air date December 07, 1950. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - The Ford Theatre "A Connecticut Yankee In King Arthur's Court" Mason Adams stars. The Mark Twain classic: a satire of chivalry, monarchy, religion, and superstition, celebrating American democratic values and ingenuity. (Original air date October 05, 1947. NBC network.) 2:30:00 - Inner Sanctum Mysteries "Tempo In Blood" A murderer introduces himself to the murderee, and a piano player plays a wrong note! (Original air date January 12, 1948. CBS network.) 3:00:00 - What Must Be Done "Education" Part two. A special series and fascinating discussion about the scourge of racism in the late '60s, and how it affects public education. Panel discussion lead by Percy Sutton. (Original air date July 8 1968. WLIB Radio, New York.)

item.title: February 19, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Henderson Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates a death in the exotic locale of… Montana? ; Parts 4 and 5 (Original air dates December 1 and 2, 1955. CBS network.) 0:30:00 - Rogers Of The Gazette Will Rogers, Jr. stars as newspaper editor in a small town, and has been receiving letters from a mysterious "A. Lincoln". (Original air date November 11, 1953. CBS.) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "No Sale" Two bullies demand that Kitty sell them the Long Branch Saloon, but she's not going down without a fight. (Original air date August 26, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - One Out Of Seven "Equality, A Most Wonderful Thing". Jack Webb does all the voices in this program, except for the singing of baritone Joseph James; program explores racial equality in post-war America. (Original air date March 20, 1946. KGO station.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Car" Someone has been robbing food markets, but not the person who confesses. (Original air date November 30, 1950. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - An Open Letter On Race Hatred Peabody Award winning broadcast written and directed by William N. Robson, detailing the 1940s Detroit race riots. (Original air date July 24, 1943. CBS network.) 2:30:00 - Black Radio: Telling It Like It Was "Civil Rights and Let's Have Church" In the fifties and sixties, Black DJs did more than play music — they were among the first messengers of the civil rights movement. In the second half of the hour, we hear about the importance of religious broadcasting to the Black community. (Original air date January 1996. PRX.) 3:00:00 - X Minus One "Dwellers In Silence" Twenty years after mankind abandoned the Earth, a spaceship from Mars lands. (Original air date November 10, 1955. NBC network.)

item.title: February 12, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Henderson Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates a death in the exotic locale of… Montana? ; Parts 1, 2 and 3 (Original air dates November 28, 29, and 30, 1955. CBS network.) 0:35:00 - Our Miss Brooks Miss Brooks tries to get Mr. Boynton to take her out to dinner for Valentine's Day. (Original air date February 19, 1950. CBS.) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Annie Oakley" A woman's love is being fought for – at least she claims it is. (Original air date August 19, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Rate Your Mate, excerpt Host Joey Adams questions a husband and wife team on this radio precursor to the popular TV show The Newlyweds. (Original air date August 5, 1950. CBS network.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Betty" A gang of swindlers has selling worthless junk to relatives of dearly departed, using obituaries as their entry point. (Original air date November 23, 1950. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - Black Radio: Telling It Like It Was 25th Anniversary Edition, Hour Two: "Jack Cooper & Al Benson" and "WDIA, The Goodwill Station" A brilliant documentary chronicling the history of African Americans and their representation in radio from the earliest days through the 1940s and 1950s. (Original air date January, 1996. PRX.) 2:30:00 - Let George Do It "The Eight Ball" Detective Valentine is mixed up in a mystery involving a dead man — who is also named George Valentine! (Original air date April 2, 1951. Mutual network.) 3:00:00 - Destination Freedom "The Heart Of George Cotton" The story of Dr. Ulysses Dailey and Daniel Hale Williams and their pioneering efforts in heart surgery. (Original air date August 8, 1948. Station WMAQ.)

item.title: February 5, 2023
item.description: 0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar "The Amy Bradshaw Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates death threats against a famous actress; Parts 4 and 5 (Original air dates November 24 and 25, 1955. CBS network.) 0:25:00 - Jubilee Ernie "Bubbles" Whitman as M.C. of this variety show created for black soldiers in WWII, featuring Cab Calloway, Burns and Allen and Nat King Cole. (Original air date February 14, 1944. AFRS.) 0:55:00 - The Studs Terkel Show featuring Sidney Poitier (Original air date October 1, 1959. WFMT station.) 1:00:00 - Gunsmoke "Snakebite" Strangers arrive in Dodge and kill a man’s dog, and revenge is swift. (Original air date August 12, 1956. CBS network.) 1:20:00 - Mail Call Ida Lupino, Robert Benchley and Groucho Marx perform a parade of the thriller Double Indemnity. (Original air date August 12, 1956. CBS network.) 1:30:00 - Dragnet "The Big Parrot" Arson in a rooming house covers up a double murder. (Original air date November 16, 1950. NBC network.) 2:00:00 - Black Radio: Telling It Like It Was 25th Anniversary Edition "Hour One: "In the Beginning" and "Pride & Enlightenment" A brilliant documentary chronicling the history of African Americans and their representation in radio from the earliest days through the 1940s and 1950s. (Original air date January 1, 1996. PRX.) 2:30:00 - Freedom's People "Contributions To Music" part of "The Story Of The American Negro." The music that the slaves brought with them to America, and how it grew. (Original air date September 21, 1944. NBC Red network.) 3:00:00 - Candy Matson, Yukon 2-8209 "Symphony Of Death" A famous composer predicts that he is going to die, and leaves a musical trail of clues. (Original air date June 20, 1950. NBC network.)

description.p:
0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Amy Bradshaw Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates death threats against a famous actress; Parts 1, 2 and 3 (Original air dates November 21, 22, and 23, 1955. CBS network.)

0:40:00 - The Chase and Sanborn Hour
Clark Gable guest stars and goes head to head with Charlie McCarthy. (Original air date October October 29, 1939. NBC network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Lost Rifle" An upsetting tale of child abuse and the consequences. (Original air date July 29, 1956. CBS network.)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Mother" A newborn has gone missing from the hospital. (Original air date November 9, 1950. NBC network.)

2:00:00 - Romance
"The Bear" A western adaptation of Chekov's one-act farce of the same name, starring Virginia Gregg and John Dehner. (Original air date November 5, 1955. CBS network.)

2:30:00 - The Charlie McCarthy Show
W.C. Fields and Charlie McCarthy face off at a barbershop. (Original air date February 20, 1944. NBC network.)

3:00:00 - The Lux Radio Theatre
"Kiss of Death" Victor Mature stars in screenwriter Ben Hecht's story of innocent gangsters, molls and revenge. (Original air date January 12,1948. CBS network.)

0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Broderick Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar must find a missing woman, who was last seen when she was only 11 years old; PARTS 4 and 5 (Original air dates November 17 and 18, 1955. CBS network.)

0:30:00 - Our Miss Brooks
Walter Denton's radio gives a strange and concerning weather report. (Original air date October 08, 1950. CBS network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Letter of the Law" Marshal Dillon is forced to evict a reformed gunfighter named Brandon Teak from his land. (Original air date July 15, 1956. CBS network.)

1:20:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Church" A new member of the congregation receives anonymous letters and phone calls threatening her with murder. (Original air date November 2, 1950. NBC network.)

1:50:00 - The Radio Almanac
Ann Sothern and Orson Welles star. (Original air date May 17, 1944. CBS network.)

2:00:00 - The Adventures Of Philip Marlowe
"Red Wind" A real Raymond Chandler story of double-crossing. (Original air date September 26, 1948. CBS network.)

2:30:00 - Inner Sanctum Mysteries
"The Vengeful Corpse" A woman burned as a witch returns to enact revenge. (Original air date September 12, 1949. CBS network.)

3:00:00 - The Eternal Light
"Try Not To Love Such A Country" Stories from Sholem Aleichem: A young boy arrives from the old country with many of the traditions from the old country. (Original air date January 13, 1963. NBC network.)

3:30:00 - I Was A Communist For The FBI
"Draw The Red Curtain". Dana Andrews stars as comrade Cvetic, assigned to help the Party take over an actor's guild. (Original air date July 06, 1952. ZIV Syndication.)

0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Broderick Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar must find a missing woman, who was last seen when she was only 11 years old; PARTS 1, 2 and 3 (Original air dates November 14, 15 and 16, 1955. CBS network.)

0:30:00 - The Studs Terkel Program
Studs Terkel interviews Martin Luther King, Jr. (Original air date October 28, 1964. Chicago station WFMT.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Passive Resistance" A man chooses to solve his quarrels without gun violence, and needs protection. (Original air date July 8, 1956. CBS network.)

1:20:00 - Lum and Abner
Lum and Abner look into insurance. (Original air date February 1, 1945. NBC Blue network.)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Meet" Joe Friday has a tense assignment, risking his life going undercover. (Original air date October 26, 1950. NBC network.)

2:00:00 - New World A'Coming
"Executive Order 8802" The history of Executive Order 8802, a temporary end to racial segregation in hiring and in the military during WWII. (Original air date November 5, 1944. New York City station WMCA.)

2:30:00 - The Adventures Of Sam Spade, Detective
"The Lazarus Caper". Howard Duff stars as Sam Spade. (Original air date September 12, 1948. CBS network.)

3:00:00 - Beyond Tomorrow
"Incident At Switchpath" An invasion! Based on the story, "The Sky Was Full Of Ships," by Theodore Sturgeon. (Original air date April 11, 1950. CBS network.)

3:30:00 - Arch Oboler's Plays
"Lust For Life". The story of Vincent Van Gogh. (Original air date August 16, 1945. NBC network.)

0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Lorko Diamonds Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates a diamond robbery in Algiers; PARTS 4 and 5 (Original air dates November 10 and 11, 1955. CBS network.)

0:30:00 - The Texaco Star Theatre
Fred Allen's first show of the 1942 season, with guest star Charles Laughton. (Original air date October 4, 1942. CBS network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Gun For Chester" Chester fears that someone is out to kill him. (Original air date July 1, 1956. CBS network.)

1:20:00 - excerpt from Duffy's Tavern Archie wants to film his life story, and hires comedian Larry Storch to impersonate Hollywood stars to fill out the cast. (Original air date January 11, 1946. NBC network.)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Grandma" An elderly woman has been passing bad checks. (Original air date October 19, 1950. NBC network.)

2:00:00 - X Minus One
"Nightmare" Based on Stephen Vincent Benet's poem, "Revolt Of The Machines"; a clerk discovers what the computers are planning. (Original air date July 21, 1955. NBC network.)

2:30:00 - The Big Show
Tallulah Bankhead's star-studded spectacle with guests Eddie Cantor, José Ferrer, Bob Hope, Jimmy Durante, and music by Meredith Willson. (Original air date November 19, 1950. NBC network.)

0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Lorko Diamonds Matter" Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar investigates a diamond robbery in Algiers; PARTS 1,2 and 3 (Original air dates November 7,8 and 9, 1955. CBS network.)

0:40:00 - Suspense
"The Thirty-Second Of December" A gambler buys a watch with many dials, including one that travels through time (Original air date December 28, 1958. CBS network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Pucket's New Year" (Original air date January 1, 1956. CBS network.)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Quack" A woman commits suicide after being robbed by a phony Dr. Schulte, owner of the Los Angeles College of Psychotherapeutics. (Original air date October 12, 1950.) NBC network.)

2:00:00 - Maxwell House Coffee Time
George Burns and Gracie Allen decide to board a returning soldier in their home. (Original air date January 3, 1946. NBC network.)

2:30:00 - Quiet, Please
"Rain On New Year's Eve" The writer of a horror movie gets in the last word. (Original air date December 31, 1947. Mutual network.)

3:00:00 - The Mercury Theatre
"Hell on Ice" A gripping dramatization of the true story of a 19th-century expedition to the North Pole, and its terrible fate. (Original broadcast date October 10, 1938. CBS network.)

0:00:00 - The First Nighter Program
"Little Town Of Bethlehem" (Original air date December 23, 1945. NBC network.) (Running time 27:46)

0:30:00 - Duffy's Tavern
Archie is fed up with the holiday, until he receives a visit from a stranger. (Original air date December 22, 1948. NBC network.) (Running time 28:56)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
Christmas in Dodge City. (Original air date December 20, 1952. NBC network.) (Running time 27:53)

1:30:00 - The Six-Shooter
A western "A Christmas Carol" with Jimmy Stewart. (Original air date December 20, 1953, NBC network.) (Running time 28:58)

2:00:00 - The Columbia Workshop
"The Day They Gave Babies Away" A Christmas story about six orphans who must find news homes. (Original air date December 21, 1946. CBS network.)(Running time 29:48)

2:30:00 - The Cavalcade Of America
"A Child Is Born" An original nativity play, by poet Stephen Vincent Benét. (Original air date December 21, 1942. NBC red network.)(Running time 29:27)

3:00:00 - Our Miss Brooks
"The Magic Christmas Tree" (Original air date December 25, 1949. CBS network.) (Running time 27:20)

3:30:00 - Philco Radio Time
Bing Crosby leads everyone in Christmas hymns such as "Adeste Fideles", and presents a moving Christmas play titled, "The Small One." (Original air date December 25, 1946, ABC network.) (Running time 27:19)

0:00:00 - Fibber McGee and Molly
Fibber paints his Christmas tree white. Teeny and The King's Men sing "The Night Before Christmas." (Original air date December 18, 1945. NBC network.) (Running time 27:00)

0:30:00 - Father Knows Best
Sometimes called "Stranded in a snowstorm"; the Anderson family has different ideas of how each would like to spend Christmas. (Original air date December 24, 1953, NBC network.) (Running time 28:07)

1:00:00 - The Columbia Workshop
"Bread On The Waters" (Original air date December 22, 1938. CBS network.) (Running time 29:49)

1:30:00 - The Greatest Story Ever Told
"No Room At The Inn". The story of the Nativity, based on the book by Fulton Oursler of the life of Jesus. (Original air date December 21, 1947. ABC network.)(Running time 24:42)

2:00:00 - Lum & Abner
"Traditional Christmas Story" A walk in the woods is something more. (Original air date December 24, 1944, NBC network.) (Running time 14:42)

2:15:00 - The Challenge Of The Yukon
A young boy gets a puppy for Christmas, thanks to Sergeant Preston. (Original air date December 19, 1946. WXYZ station.)(Running time 14:18)

2:30:00 - Family Theatre
"Lullaby Of Christmas". A Christmas fable about a young boy who could not speak, at the time of the birth of Jesus. (Original air date December 19, 1951. Mutual network)(Running time 29:56)

3:00:00 - The Campbell Playhouse
"A Christmas Carol" Lionel Barrymore in his defining role, in Charles Dicken's classic ghost story. (Original air date December 24, 1939. CBS network.)(Running time 54:12)

itunes:keywords.p:
0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Missing Mouse Matter" A singing mouse named Gulliver has been kidnapped — wait, a singing mouse? (Original air date December 23, 1956. CBS network.)

0:30:00 - Suspense
"The Cave" A fanciful story about two boys who discover pirates in a magical cave on Christmas Day. (Original air date December 20, 1955. CBS network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Where'd They Go?" Marshal Dillon and Chester ride out to arrest a man accused of robbery but are sidetracked by charitable needs and deeds. (Original air date December 29, 1957. CBS network.)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big Little Jesus" A Los Angeles Mission reports the statue of Jesus has been stolen the day before Christmas. (Original air date December 22, 1953.) NBC network.)

2:00:00 - The Eternal Light
"Anne Frank: The Diary Of A Young Girl" A radio adaptation of the famous journal by Anne Frank, a Jewish teenager who chronicled her family's life in hiding under Nazi persecution. (Original air date December 14, 1952. NBC network.)

2:30:00 - Rocky Fortune
"The Plot To Murder Santa Claus" Frank Sinatra stars as detective Rocky Fortune; there's a plot to murder Santa Claus. (Original air date December 22, 1953. NBC network.)
2:52:00 - excerpt New World A'Coming (Original air date December 24, 1944.)

3:00:00 - The Shadow
"Cold Death" Orson Welles stars as The Shadow, entering the mind of a Scrooge-like slumlord who keeps the press out of his shantytown with gangsters. (Original broadcast date December 19, 1937. Mutual network.)

3:00:00 - Broadway Is My Beat
Nick Norman is just out of Sing Sing after fifteen years and is scheduled to play Santa Claus for the P.A.L. (Original broadcast date December 24, 1949. CBS network.)

description.p:
0:00:00 - Yours Truly, Johnny Dollar
"The Valentine Matter" Parts 4 and 5. Bob Bailey as Johnny Dollar, investigating the murder of Danny Valentine. (Original air date November 3 and 4, 1955. CBS network.)

0:30:00 - My Favorite Husband
Lucille Ball as Liz Cooper; there are only seven shopping days until Christmas. What is George planning to give Liz for Christmas? (Original air date December 16, 1949. CBS network.)

1:00:00 - Gunsmoke
"Cheap Labor" A peaceful man is threatened by a jealous brother of his fiancée. (Original air date June 17, 1956. CBS network.)
1:20:00 - Excerpt from "The Sound of Jazz" featuring Billie Holiday's "Fine and Mellow" (Original air date December 8, 1957)

1:30:00 - Dragnet
"The Big 38" A brutal story of a store clerk shot and murdered. (Original air date October 5, 1950.) NBC network.)(Running time 26:04)

2:00:00 - The Challenge Of The Yukon
"The Man With The Red Coat" A little girl confuses Sergeant Preston's red Mountie suit with Santa's costume. (Original air date December 22, 1948. ABC network.)

2:30:00 - Suspense
"Out For Christmas" Raymond Burr stars as an ex-con who gets out of jail just before Christmas, looking for trouble. (Original air date December 21, 1958. CBS network.)(Running time 23:29)

3:00:00 - Big Town
Edward G. Robinson stars as Steve Wilson of the The Illustrated Press, who investigates a suspicious Christmas charity racket. (Original broadcast date December 21, 1937. CBS network.)(Running time 26:26)

3:00:00 - Quiet Please
"Berlin, 1945" A great Christmas story about a group of American G.I.'s celebrating the holiday in conquered Germany. (Original broadcast date December 26, 1948. ABC network.)(Running time 28:59)
